name: parataxis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a situation in which two clauses or phrases are used one after the other without a conjunction (= connecting word) between them to show their relationship to each other: "May I be happy; may I be peaceful; may I be free" is an example of parataxis. In particular, he notes parataxis as a frequent feature of this style. The entire text is composed in a loose manner that borders on parataxis.

It exemplifies a style of poetry based on the rhetorical figure of parataxis units placed together without connectives or subordination.
